column4: I have seriuos audio problem, how can I reconfigure my audiocard?
can you give the output of:   wget -O alsa-info.sh http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh && chmod +x ./alsa-info.sh && ./alsa-info.sh
Your ALSA information is in /tmp/alsa-info.txt.5JMYRlsU5k
ok, run:  sudo apt-get install pastebinit; pastebinit /tmp/alsa-info.txt.5JMYRlsU5k      what is output?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/849238/
does the system have a make and model?
no sorry, I made this computer by myself
from scratch
so what is your sound issue?

I have 3 Soundcard: 1st is the motherboard integrated, 2 nd is the videocard HDMI,  3rd is my Soundblaster Live! PCI card. I have disabled the 1st and 2nd. I only wanna work with the SB live. This is the issue: I was recording with the line-in input and then I am unable to switch back to the mic-in input.
The audio input is locked on line-in so I can't use skype or any other software. Only Line-in input is working.
I have tryed to change the audio settings but it doesn't work.
Creative cards can be a pain
try:  killall pulseaudio; rm -r ~/.pulse*     then wait a few seconds, see if it helps
oww..so bad...anyway that card has so low latency
also the audio quality recording and playback is really great compared to the integrated soundcard.
is there a way to reset pulseaudio or reconfigure it?
I gave the command to reset it
where? I only recived the alsa formation script and the pastebin
(22:25:39) ActionParsnip: Bender__: try:  killall pulseaudio; rm -r ~/.pulse*     then wait a few seconds, see if it helps
thank you, I give a try...
it works! After that I found my audio settings to be reconfigured (disable the other 2 cards) and unmute the mic-in
solved :) Thank you a lot!
nice. No worries dude
